vehicles.description: A white sedan is on the left side of the road, facing the direction away from the self-driving vehicle.
vehicles.explanation: The white sedan is currently stationary and does not affect driving behavior, but caution is advised in case it starts moving or turning.

vehicles.description: A construction vehicle (front-end loader) is parked at an angle on the right side of the road, partially encroaching upon the lane, facing left.
vehicles.explanation: Its position suggests that it may obstruct the vehicle's path or it might move, necessitating caution and preparedness to stop or detour.

other objects.description: A bicycle is parked on the right side of the road, close to the building.
other objects.explanation: These will not directly affect driving behavior, but the vehicle should remain in the proper lane to ensure there is no interference.

general_perception.description and explanation: The traffic image shows a white sedan on the left side of the road, facing away from the self-driving vehicle. This sedan is currently stationary and is not affecting driving behavior but requires caution in case it starts moving or turning. Additionally, on the right side of the road, there is a construction vehicle, specifically a front-end loader, parked at an angle and partially encroaching upon the lane while facing left. This vehicle may obstruct the path of the self-driving vehicle or might move, necessitating caution and readiness to either stop or detour. There is also a parked bicycle on the right side of the road, close to a building. Although this bicycle does not directly affect driving behavior, the vehicle should ensure it remains in the proper lane to avoid any interference.

driving_suggestion: Due to the presence of construction vehicles that may move or obstruct parts of the traffic lanes, please drive cautiously. Maintain a safe distance from the stationary sedan on your left in case it suddenly moves. Pay special attention to bicycles on your right, and be prepared to change your lane position according to the road width and traffic conditions to maintain a safe distance. It is not recommended to change lanes immediately unless construction vehicles begin to enter the roadway or obstruct the normal driving route of your vehicle. Since wet road conditions may affect braking distance, it is necessary to adjust the driving style accordingly.

1.description and explanation: This is a construction vehicle, particularly a wheel loader, often used in roadwork or construction sites for moving or loading materials. Its presence indicates potential roadwork ahead. In the context of driving, the ego car should slow down, be prepared for possible detours or lane closures, and watch for construction workers and additional construction machinery entering or exiting the work area.

2.description and explanation: This is a parked bicycle, typically a human-powered vehicle with two wheels held in a frame one behind the other. The bicycle's location near the edge of the road could create an obstruction if the rider decides to start moving into traffic or if the bike falls onto the road. The driver of the ego car should maintain a safe distance and be vigilant of the bicycle potentially entering the traffic flow.
